column4: I am going to scream, I have been trying to get vnc to work on ubuntu for 4 hours now. Every time I try to connect to tightvnc, it asks for the password, then I click ok and it says connection closed. Any ideas whats going on?
I am seriously going to blow up my computer, anyone know how to get VNC working on ubuntu?
why dont you use desktop sharing or ssh?
The other person only has windows
How do I do that? Vino?
well, at leat krdc in KDE does
btw you can access ssh from windoze machina w/ putty
I am trying to show clients stuff on my desktop while talking on skype
he has raw ports blocked on his machine, how do I configure it for a different port?
ohkay, but desktop sharing works, like a charm (well not for watching movies, of coarse) in KDE, so i guess vino will serve same way in gnome
So how do I change it to a different port?
dunno, but you can port forward on router meanwhile :))
so vino is not working, then? you got 5900 or other opened?
try to scan the ports with nmap or so
